abstract: The recent agreement to pay $2.5 billion for China Huiyuan Juice chisels away at Coke’s dependence on carbonated drinks and expands the company’s presence in a huge, fast-growing economy.
snippet: The recent agreement to pay $2.5 billion for China Huiyuan Juice chisels away at Coke’s dependence on carbonated drinks and expands the company’s presence in a huge, fast-growing economy.
lead_paragraph: THIS has been the wrong summer to invest in dark liquids. Crude oil has plunged and so have shares of the soft drink maker Coca-Cola. Coke’s decline has captured less attention, but it seems to have much in common  beyond color coordination  with crude’s reversal of fortune.

headline.main: China Deal Draws Praise for Coke
headline.print_headline: China Deal Draws Praise For Coke
